summary: The text discusses the Jews, depicted as a foolish and scattered people, who followed Christ despite their ignorance. It describes them as being taken captive, referring to historical events under the Roman emperors Titus and Vespasian. The text also highlights the symbolic significance of the five loaves and two fishes, which represent the books of Mosaic law and the prophets and Psalms, testifying to Christ as both king and priest.
